examples: “I would be given for supper six ounces of bread and ‘three parts of skilly.’ ‘Three parts’ means three-quarters of a pint, and ‘skilly’ is a fluid concoction of three quarts of oatmeal stirred into three buckets and a half of hot water.”

description: From Middle English skylly, skily, equivalent to skill +‎ -y.

adjectives.description: skilly (comparative more skilly, superlative most skilly)

examples: So, being a fell impatient man, and skilly with his hands, he took Sam Gourlay a clout in the lug that couped him down in the stour  […]
